title: Assur Archive 51
description: At the eastern corner of the large ziggurat in Assur, a library, belonging to a family of scribes, was unearthed in a house in area hB4V (Assur Archive 18). In a door opening of a small house nearby, excavators found a clay pot with 13 tablets inside. This separate archive belongs to Aššur-bissu-epuš and other men. It also dates to the 7th-century BCE. and contains various types of documents, including a juridical settlement and a document concerning the deposit of a chair.

properties.description: Representative locations of the Neo-Assyrian archive at Assur on the basis of Pedersén 1987 Plan(s) 62.
properties.title: Plan location of Assur Archive 51
